text: meets the mehrbod it's called ocean one
and on its first dive it picked up a
vase from a 17th century Mediterranean
wreck this was just a test Stanford
researchers designed this underwater
avatar to go where human divers
shouldn't go places that are too deep or
too dangerous the robot is intelligent
enough to grip objects or avoid
obstacles on its own so human operators
on the surface don't have to think of
everything the designers had a few
reasons for making it look human
or perhaps Merman since it doesn't have
legs humanoid hands and arms are good
for delicate work the cameras for eyes
are ideally positioned to see what the
hands are doing it also has haptic or
touch feedback its form makes it
intuitive for humans to operate it
remotely and sometimes the mehrbod does
work with human divers and when you're
underwater it's nice to see a friendly
face
Oh
